title: Singer Jill Sobule, best known for her 1995 hit “I Kissed a Girl,” dies in house fire
summary: Singer Jill Sobule, best known for her 1995 hit “I Kissed a Girl,” died in house fire at the age of 66.
story: Singer Jill Sobule, best known for her 1995 hit “I Kissed a Girl,” died May 1 in a Minnesota house fire, her publicist confirmed to NBC News. She was 66.
The blaze happened in Woodbury, which is located about 15 miles outside of Minneapolis.
Sobule’s 1990 debut album, “Things Here Are Different,” spawned the single “Too Cool to Fall in Love,” which reached No. 17 on the Billboard Adult Contemporary chart.

Her biggest mainstream success came five years later with “I Kissed a Girl,” which reached the top 20 on Billboard’s Modern Rock chart (now known as the Alternative Airplay chart), the first openly queer-themed track to do so. The song was accompanied by a video featuring Fabio. Sobule’s “I Kissed a Girl” was a different song altogether from Katy Perry’s smash 2008 song of the same name.
Sobule once made sarcastic comments about Perry’s song, which some Perry fans took seriously and lashed out at Sobule because of it.

“I may be a touch cynical about the business, but I have never really been angry or had ill feelings towards Katy herself,” Sobule wrote in response to the backlash in a post for The Huffington Post in 2009. “I was actually in a small way happy to not be the ‘Kissed a Girl’ girl anymore. That said, I hope her and her fans (god knows I don’t want to piss them off anymore) are okay with the title of my brand new song, “ I Kissed a Girl ...First.’ Wink.”
Sobule’s song “Supermodel” also appeared on the soundtrack for Alicia Silverstone’s hit 1995 movie, “Clueless.”

Most recently, Sobule, who was also an early proponent of crowdfunding, created “F--- 7th Grade,” an autobiographical coming-of-age off-Broadway musical that was a New York Times Critic’s pick that debuted in 2022. The production earned a Drama Desk nomination for outstanding musical.

“Jill Sobule was a force of nature and human rights advocate whose music is woven into our culture. I was having so much fun working with her. I lost a client & a friend today. I hope her music, memory, & legacy continue to live on and inspire others,” her manager, John Porter, said in a statement.
Sobule had been scheduled to perform May 2 in Denver at Swallow Hill. That site will now be host to a gathering in her honor.
Sobule is survived by her brother and sister-in-law, James and Mary Ellen Sobule, as well as nephews, Ian Matthew and Robert and Robert’s wife, Irina.

title: When is the 2025 Met Gala? How the date is chosen each year
summary: When is the 2025 Met Gala? Here's how the date is chosen and why it is the first Monday in May.
story: The 2025 Met Gala will be an extravagant event — as it always is. Stars will come dressed to the nines (and 10s) on fashion's biggest night.
The theme for this year is “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” which celebrates the concept of Black dandyism.

In a press release, the Met said the theme was inspired by Barnard College chair and professor Monica L. Miller’s 2009 book called “Slaves to Fashion: Black Dandyism and the Styling of Black Diasporic Identity.”
The museum also said the dress code, “Tailored For You,” is “a nod to the exhibition’s focus on suiting and menswear.”
According to Vogue, this will be the first time since 2003 that the gala will feature predominantly menswear at the gala.
When is the 2025 Met Gala?
The 2025 Met Gala will take place at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on Monday, May 5.
How is the date chosen?
The Met Gala is typically held on the first Monday in May in New York — but the tradition is relatively new, compared to the event's history.
The Costume Institute’s first fundraiser was held in 1948 in the fall. Until 2001, the Met Gala was held in November or December.
From 2002 to 2004, the party was in April. Then came 2005. The "Celebrating Chanel"-themed event was first time the Met Gala was held the first Monday of May.

Since then, it's been a tradition, enough so that a documentary about the Met Gala was entitled "The First Monday in May." This means next year's Met Gala will be on May 4, May 3 in 2027 and May 1 in 2028.
Though the Met Gala is not always in May. In 2021, the celebration was moved to September due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Prince William and Kate commemorate Princess Charlotte’s 10th birthday with new photo
summary: Prince William and Kate Middleton have released a photo of Princess Charlotte for her 10th birthday.
story: The British royal family is celebrating Princess Charlotte's 10th birthday.
On May 2, the official Instagram account of Charlotte's parents — Prince William and Kate, the Princess of Wales — shared a new photo of the young royal.

In the snap, Charlotte is seen posing with a big smile as a picturesque backdrop of mountains and a valley illuminates her background. The 10-year-old sports a camouflage jacket and blue plants as she leans back on the grass beneath her.
The post was simply captioned, "Happy 10th Birthday Princess Charlotte!"
William and Kate have a tradition of releasing portraits of their children to mark their birthdays.

Last week, their youngest, Prince Louis, was all smiles in a new photo for his 7th birthday on April 23. He cheesed for the camera as he showed off his missing baby teeth. And their oldest, Prince George, was dapper in his portrait as he turned 12 last July.

Charlotte's birthday photo from 2024, when she turned 9, showed the young royal posing among pretty flowers in a garden. Like many other portraits of Will and Kate's kids, this one was taken by Kate herself.

Kate shares updates on the three children from time to time, too. In February, she showed off their drawing skills during an art session for The Royal Foundation Centre for Early Childhood, which she founded in 2021. The drawings were a part of the royal foundation’s “Shaping Us Framework” initiative, which highlights the role that creativity plays in childhood development.
